property.name: lens.server.drivers
property.description: Drivers enabled for this lens server instance

property.name: lens.server.driver.selector.class
property.description: Class for selecting best driver given the query context

property.name: lens.server.query.acceptors
property.description: Query Acceptors configured. Query acceptors are consulted first, before anything happens for the given query. They can either return null or return a messaging indicating why the given query shouldn't be accepted. These can be used to filter out queries at the earliest.

property.name: lens.server.query.phase1.rewriters
property.description: Query phase 1 rewriters. This is to convert user query to cube query. The resulting cube query will be passed for validation and rewriting to hql query.\ Use cases will be to use extra intelligence to convert user query to optimized cube query.\ Or define shortcuts for certain frequently used queries :)

property.name: lens.server.query.state.logger.enabled
property.description: Disable or enable the query state logger with this config. The location for the logger can be specified in logback xml for the class org.apache.lens.server.query.QueryExecutionServiceImpl.QueryStatusLogger

property.name: lens.server.event.service.thread.pool.size
property.description: The size of thread pool for notifying events. The no value is specified, it uses the available processors as the number.

property.name: lens.server.enable.console.metrics
property.description: Enable metrics to be reported on console

property.name: lens.server.enable.csv.metrics
property.description: Enable metrics to be reported as csv files in a directory

property.name: lens.server.metrics.csv.directory.path
property.description: Path of the directory in which to report metrics as separate csv files.

property.name: lens.server.enable.ganglia.metrics
property.description: Enable metrics to be reported on ganglia

property.name: lens.server.metrics.ganglia.host
property.description: The ganglia host name

property.name: lens.server.metrics.ganglia.port
property.description: The ganglia port

property.name: lens.server.enable.graphite.metrics
property.description: Enable metrics to be reported on graphite

property.name: lens.server.metrics.graphite.host
property.description: The graphite host name

property.name: lens.server.metrics.graphite.port
property.description: The graphite port

property.name: lens.server.enable.resource.method.metering
property.description: Whether to Enable metering for all resource methods.

property.name: lens.server.metrics.reporting.period
property.description: The reporting period for metrics. The value is in seconds

property.name: lens.server.state.persistence.enabled
property.description: If flag is enabled, state of all the services will be persisted periodically to a location specified by lens.server.persist.location and on server restart all the services will be started from last saved state.

property.name: lens.server.state.persistence.interval.millis
property.description: Lens server state persistence time interval in milliseconds

property.name: lens.server.persist.location
property.description: The directory in which lens server will persist its state when it is going down. The location be on any Hadoop compatible file system. Server will read from the location when it is restarted and recovery is enabled. So, Server should have both read and write permissions to the location

property.name: lens.server.mode
property.description: The mode in which server should run. Allowed values are OPEN, READ_ONLY, METASTORE_READONLY, METASTORE_NODROP. OPEN mode will allow all requests. READ_ONLY mode will allow all requests on session resouce and only GET requests on all other resources. METASTORE_READONLY will allow GET on metastore and all other requests in other services. METASTORE_NODROP will not allow DELETE on metastore, will allow all other requests.

property.name: lens.server.session.timeout.seconds
property.description: Lens session timeout in seconds.If there is no activity on the session for this period then the session will be closed.Default timeout is one day.

property.name: lens.server.statistics.store.class
property.description: Default implementation of class used to persist Lens Statistics.

property.name: lens.server.statistics.log.rollover.interval
property.description: Default rate which log statistics store scans for rollups in milliseconds.

property.name: lens.server.statistics.warehouse.dir
property.description: Default top level location where stats are moved by the log statistics store.

property.name: lens.server.statistics.db
property.description: Database to which statistics tables are created and partitions are added.

property.name: lens.server.resultset.purge.enabled
property.description: Whether to purge the query results

property.name: lens.server.resultsetpurger.sleep.interval.secs
property.description: Periodicity for Query result purger runs. Default 1 hour.

property.name: lens.server.query.resultset.retention
property.description: Lens query resultset retention period. Default 1 day

property.name: lens.server.hdfs.output.retention
property.description: hdfs output retention period. Default 1 day

property.name: lens.server.querypurger.sleep.interval
property.description: The interval(milliseconds) with which purger to run periodically. Default 10 sec.

property.name: lens.server.inmemory.resultset.ttl.secs
property.description: This property defines the TTL(time to live) in seconds for all result sets of type InMemoryResultSet beyond which they are eligible for purging irrespective of whether the result set has been read or not. The default value is 300 seconds (5 minutes).

property.name: lens.server.domain
property.description: Server domain. This will be used in authentication and Sending emails to users. For the server, the username will be without domain and domain will come through conf.

property.name: lens.server.db.driver.name
property.description: Database driver for database where Finished queries have to be stored. Also used for database based user config loaders

property.name: lens.server.db.jdbc.url
property.description: JDBC URL where the database for storing finished queries is located. Also used for database based user config loaders

property.name: lens.server.db.jdbc.user
property.description: JDBC User for Finished queries table. Also used for database based user config loaders

property.name: lens.server.db.jdbc.pass
property.description: JDBC Password for Finished queries table. Also used for database based user config loaders

property.name: lens.server.db.validation.query
property.description: BasicDatasource has a config parameter called validationQuery. This query is run before passing the Datasource to the application to verify if connection is valid.\ {{{http://commons.apache.org/proper/commons-dbcp/configuration.html}dbcp configuration}} \ {{{http://stackoverflow.com/questions/10684244/dbcp-validationquery-for-different-databases}validationquery for different databases}} \

property.name: lens.server.mail.from.address
property.description: The from field in the notifier mail to the submitter.

property.name: lens.server.mail.host
property.description: SMTP Host for sending mail

property.name: lens.server.mail.port
property.description: SMTP Port

property.name: lens.server.mail.smtp.timeout
property.description: Socket read timeout value in milliseconds. This timeout is implemented by java.net.Socket. Default is 30 seconds.

property.name: lens.server.mail.smtp.connectiontimeout
property.description: Socket connection timeout value in milliseconds. This timeout is implemented by java.net.Socket. Default is 15 seconds.

property.name: hive.server2.async.exec.threads
property.description: Number of threads required in async thread pool for query execution in the lens directly. Lens uses query execution directly only to add and delete resources, which are mostly synchronous. So keeping to a lower value.

property.name: hive.server2.log.redirection.enabled
property.description: Disable the log direction on the lens server sessions. There are no logs required for each session in lens sessions. This will decrease number of file handles associated to lens server.

property.name: hive.server2.logging.operation.enabled
property.description: Disable the operation logging, since there are no execution operation happening in lens session. Keeping it true might conflict with Hive Server if both are running on the same machine causing disappearance of the operation log directory.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication
property.description: Client authentication types. NONE: no authentication check LDAP: LDAP/AD based authentication KERBEROS: Kerberos/GSSAPI authentication CUSTOM: Custom authentication provider (Use with property hive.server2.custom.authentication.class) PAM: Pluggable authentication module.

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.url
property.description: LDAP connection URL

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.security.protocol
property.description: Its value is a string determined by the service provider (e.g. "ssl"). If this property is unspecified, the behaviour is determined by the service provider. It's value will be directly passed as "java.naming.security.protocol"

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.baseDN
property.description: LDAP base DN

property.name: hive.server2.authentication.ldap.Domain
property.description: The ldap domin

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.type
property.description: Type of user config resolver. allowed values are FIXED, PROPERTYBASED, DATABASE, LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE, CUSTOM.

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.fixed.value
property.description: Required for FIXED user resolver. when lens.server.user.resolver.type=FIXED, This will be the value cluster user will resolve to.

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.propertybased.filename
property.description: Required for PROPERTYBASED user resolver. when lens.server.user.resolver.type is PROPERTYBASED, then this file will be read and parsed to determine cluster user. Each line should contain username followed by DOT followed by property full name followed by equal-to sign and followed by value. example schema of the file is: user1.lens.server.cluster.user=clusteruser1 user1.mapred.job.queue.name=queue1 *.lens.server.cluster.user=defaultclusteruser *.mapred.job.queue.name=default

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.custom.class
property.description: Required for CUSTOM user resolver. In case the provided implementations are not sufficient for user config resolver, a custom classname can be provided. Class should extend org.apache.lens.server.user.UserConfigLoader

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.db.keys
property.description: Required for DATABASE and LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. For database based user config loaders, the conf keys that will be loaded from database.

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.db.query
property.value: select clusteruser,queue from user_config_table where username=?
property.description: Required for DATABASE and LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. For database based user config loader, this query will be run with single argument = logged in user and the result columns will be assigned to lens.server.user.resolver.db.keys in order. For ldap backed database resolver, the argument to this query will be the intermediate values obtained from ldap.

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.intermediate.db.query
property.value: select department from user_department where username=? and expiry>?
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. query to obtain intermediate values from database backing ldap as cache. two arguments: logged in user and current time.

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.intermediate.db.delete.sql
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. query to delete intermediate values from database backing ldap as cache. one argument: logged in user.

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.intermediate.db.insert.sql
property.value: insert into user_department (username, department, expiry) values (?, ?, ?)
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. query to insert intermediate values from database backing ldap as cache. arguments: first logged in user, then all intermediate values, then current time + expiration time

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.fields
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. list of fields to be obtained from ldap. These will be cached by the intermediate db.

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.bind.dn
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. ldap dn for admin binding example: CN=company-it-admin,ou=service-account,ou=company-service-account,dc=dc1,dc=com...

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.bind.password
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. ldap password for admin binding above

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.search.base
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. for searching intermediate values for a user, the search keys. example: cn=users,dc=dc1,dc=dc2...

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.search.filter
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. filter pattern for ldap search

property.name: lens.server.user.resolver.ldap.url
property.description: Required for LDAP_BACKED_DATABASE user resolvers. ldap url to connect to.

property.name: lens.server.service.provider.factory
lens.server.state.persist.out.stream.buffer.size
property.description: Output Stream Buffer Size used in writing lens server state to file system. Size is in bytes.

property.name: lens.server.database.resource.dir
property.description: Top level directory to store database specific static resources which are added to each database. To add a static resource for a DB, create a directory with the same name as that of the DB under this directory, and place the resources inside the DB directory. Any subdirectories under the DB directory and the resources under them will be ignored

property.name: lens.server.estimate.timeout.millis
property.description: Timeout for parallel query estimate calls in milliseconds. A driver needs to comeback with a query estimate within this timeout. If the timeout is reached, only the drivers that have provided an estimate would be considered for query selection. If the timeout is reached and none of the drivers have provided an estimate then estimate calls fails with an exception.

property.name: lens.server.estimate.pool.min.threads
property.description: Minimum number of threads in the estimate thread pool

property.name: lens.server.estimate.pool.max.threads
property.description: Maximum number of threads in the estimate thread pool

property.name: lens.server.estimate.pool.keepalive.millis
property.description: Thread keep alive time in milliseconds for the estimate thread pool. If there are no estimate requests for this period,then cached threads are released from the pool.

property.name: lens.server.launcher.pool.min.threads
property.description: Minimum number of threads in the query launcher thread pool

property.name: lens.server.launcher.pool.max.threads
property.description: Maximum number of threads in the query launcher thread pool. Keeping the default to hundred, we may never grow till there, it would go to max for concurrrent queries allowed on all drivers together. This value should be greater than the max concurrent queries allowed on all drivers.

property.name: lens.server.launcher.pool.keepalive.millis
property.description: Thread keep alive time in milliseconds for the query launcher thread pool. If there are no query launches for this period,then cached threads will be released from the pool.

property.name: lens.server.session.expiry.service.interval.secs
property.description: Interval at which lens session expiry service runs

property.name: lens.server.scheduling.queue.poll.interval.millisec
property.description: The interval at which submission thread will poll scheduling queue to fetch the next query for submission. If value is less than equal to 0, then it would mean that thread will continuosly poll without sleeping. The interval has to be given in milliseconds.

property.name: lens.server.query.launching.constraint.factories
property.description: Factories used to instantiate constraints enforced on queries by lens. Every Factory should be an implementation of org.apache.lens.server.api.common.ConfigBasedObjectCreationFactory and create an implementation of org.apache.lens.server.api.query.constraint.QueryLaunchingConstraint. A query will be launched only if all constraints pass.

property.name: lens.server.total.query.cost.ceiling.per.user
property.description: A query submitted by user will be launched only if total query cost of all current launched queries of user is less than or equal to total query cost ceiling defined by this property. This configuration value is only useful when TotalQueryCostCeilingConstraint is enabled by using org.apache.lens.server.query.constraint.TotalQueryCostCeilingConstraintFactory as one of the factories in lens.server.query.constraint.factories property. Default is -1.0 which means that there is no limit on the total query cost of launched queries submitted by a user.

property.name: lens.server.waiting.queries.selection.policy.factories
property.description: Factories used to instantiate waiting queries selection policies. Every factory should be an implementation of org.apache.lens.server.api.common.ConfigBasedObjectCreationFactory and create an implementation of org.apache.lens.server.api.query.collect.WaitingQueriesSelectionPolicy.

property.name: lens.server.savedquery.jdbc.dialectclass
property.description: Dialect of the target DB, Default is HSQL. Override with the target DB used.

property.name: lens.server.savedquery.list.default.offset
property.description: Key denoting the default start value of saved query list api.

property.name: lens.server.savedquery.list.default.count
property.description: Key denoting the default fetch value of saved query list api.

property.name: lens.server.max.sessions.per.user
property.description: Number of sessions can be allowed for each user. User has to close one of the active sessions to open a new session once limit is reached. Otherwise Server throws an exception by saying that opened session limit has been already reached for user.

property.name: lens.server.status.update.num.retries
property.description: The number of retries a status update will tried with exponentital back off, in case of transient issues, upon which query will be marked FAILED.

property.name: lens.server.status.update.maximum.delay.secs
property.description: The maximum delay in seconds for next status update to happen after any transient failure. This will be used a maximum delay sothat exponential wait times not to grow to bigger value.

property.name: lens.server.duplicate.query.allowed
property.description: If this is false and same query is submitted by a user in the same session and with the same configuration while earlier query is not completed then lens server will return the handle of the previous query

property.name: lens.server.scheduler.store.class
property.description: A subclass of SchedulerDBStore class used for storing scheduler related information.

property.name: lens.server.status.update.exponential.wait.millis
property.description: Number of millis that would grow exponentially for next update, incase of transient failures.

property.name: lens.query.current.time.millis
property.description: Query current time in millis. This is used to resolve 'now'. If value is set to zero, 'now' is resolved to current value

property.name: lens.server.http.notification.conn.timeout.millis
property.description: This is the connection timeout for all HTTP Notifications sent by lens server. Default connection timeout is 5 secs

property.name: lens.server.http.notification.read.timeout.millis
property.description: This is the read timeout for all HTTP Notifications sent by lens server. Default read timeout is 10 secs

property.name: lens.server.grizzly.core.pool.size
property.description: Core pool size for lens grizzly server

property.name: lens.server.grizzly.max.pool.size
property.description: Max pool size for lens grizzly server

property.name: lens.server.scheduler.max.job.per.user
property.description: The maximum number of jobs per user which can be scheduled. -1 means unlimited jobs.
